alert.note: Alert for Kane; Washington (Utah) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flash Flood Warning issued October 03 at 6:07AM MDT until October 03 at 8:30AM MDT by NWS Saltlake
info.description: ...FLASH FLOOD WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 830 AM MDT THIS MORNING FOR WEST CENTRAL KANE AND EAST CENTRAL WASHINGTON COUNTIES... At 607 AM MDT, Doppler radar indicated thunderstorms producing heavy rain across the warned area. Flash flooding is ongoing or expected to begin shortly. HAZARD...Life threatening flash flooding. Thunderstorms producing flash flooding. SOURCE...Radar. IMPACT...Life threatening flash flooding of normally dry washes, slot canyons and small streams. Some locations that will experience flash flooding include... Zion National Park, Behunin Canyon, Echo Canyon, Keyhole, Pine, Spry Canyons, Parunuweap Canyon, and the Narrows. Heavy rain is also occurring on State Route 9 through the switchbacks up to the Zion Tunnel. Slow down and watch for debris on the road. This includes the following streams and drainages... Deep Creek, East Fork Virgin River, Right Fork North Creek, Shunes Creek, South Creek, Kolob Creek, Blue Creek, Virgin River, North Fork Virgin River, Oak Creek and Clear Creek. FLASH FLOOD...RADAR INDICATED FLASH FLOOD DAMAGE THREAT...CONSIDERABLE
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Remain alert for flooding even in locations not receiving rain. Dry washes, streams, and rivers can become raging killer currents in a matter of minutes, even from distant rainfall.
